preamble.p: An Act to provide for the extension of the Prisons Act, 1894 to the Union Territory of Mizoram
Be it enacted by the Legislative Assembly of Mizoram in the Thirty-second Year of the Republic of India as follows:

content.p: This Act may be called the Prisons (Extension to Mizoram) Act, 1981.
It extends to the whole of the Union Territory of Mizoram.
It shall come into force at once.

section.heading: Extension of Central Act 9 of 1894 to the Union Territory of Mizoram

content.p: Notwithstanding any notification barring the application of the Prisons Act, 1894 to the former Lushai Hills District, the said Act and the rules made there under, as in force in the State of Assam immediately before the 21st day of January, 1972, are hereby extended to the Union Territory of Mizoram and shall be deemed to have come into force in that territory with effect from the 21st day of January, 1972.

Anything done or any action taken by the Administrator of the Union Territory of Mizoram or by any other officer or authority in the purported exercise of the powers under any of the provisions of the Act and the rules extended to the Union Territory of Mizoram by sec tion 2 on or after the 21st day of January, 1972 and before the commencement of this Act shall be deemed to have been validly done or taken as if the provisions of the said Act and rules had been in force at all material times when such thing was done or action was taken, and accordingly no suit or other proceedings shall be maintained or continued in any Court questioning the legality of any such thing done or action taken:

Provided that no contravention of, or failure to comply with any provisions of the Act and the rules extended to the Union Territory of Mizoram by section 2 shall render any person guilty of an offence punishable under the said Act and rules if such contravention or failure had occurred before the commencement of this Act.
